creator: gtoal
title: Fitting the MaxAmps 2600mAh extended battery to the A R Drone
materials_required: Replacement velcro strap (comes with the battery)
JB Weld (for optional cross piece repair)
Plastic epoxy (for optional cross piece repair)
description: This project details how to properly install a MaxAmps 2600mAh extended battery in an A R Drone to prevent it from slipping during flight. The battery is not a direct fit, requiring additional steps to secure it. It also describes how to fix a broken central cross piece using JB Weld as a stop-gap measure.
steps: Compare the MaxAmps 2600mAh battery with the stock battery to observe the size and shape differences.
Identify the gaps between the new battery and the drone's battery compartment.
Cut foam to fill the gaps on the sides and end of the new battery within the battery compartment.
Strip down the drone to remove the existing velcro strap and fit the replacement strap that came with the battery.
Optionally, if the central cross piece is broken, repair it using plastic epoxy to hold the pieces in place and then cover the central area with JB Weld for structural support.
